billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Prohibits a member of the legislature from engaging in any outside paid activity during his or her term of office
summary: Prohibits a member of the legislature from engaging in any outside paid activity during his or her term of office.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          284

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  DIAZ  --  read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Investigations and Govern-
         ment Operations

       AN ACT to amend the legislative law, in relation to prohibiting  outside
         work by a legislator during the term of office

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The legislative law is amended by adding a new section  2-a
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S 2-A. MEMBERS PROHIBITED FROM ENGAGING IN OUTSIDE ACTIVITY FOR REMUN-
    4  ERATION  WHILE IN OFFICE. NO MEMBER OF THE LEGISLATURE, EITHER SENATE OR
    5  ASSEMBLY, SHALL ENGAGE IN ANY OUTSIDE ACTIVITY FOR REMUNERATION  OF  ANY
    6  KIND DURING HIS OR HER TERM OF OFFICE.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect January 1, 2012.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02585-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the legislative law, in relation to prohibiting outside work by a legislator during the term of office
